description: Returns a description of a hyperparameter tuning job, depending on the fields selected. These fields can include the name, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), job status of your tuning job and more.

parameters.name: HyperParameterTuningJobName
parameters.description: The name of the tuning job.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterTuningJobName
nested_items.description: The name of the hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterTuningJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the tuning job.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterTuningJobConfig
nested_items.description: The HyperParameterTuningJobConfig object that specifies the configuration of the tuning job.

nested_items.name: Strategy
nested_items.description: Specifies how hyperparameter tuning chooses the combinations of hyperparameter values to use for the training job it launches. For information about search strategies, see How Hyperparameter Tuning Works.

nested_items.name: StrategyConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the Hyperband optimization strategy. This parameter should be provided only if Hyperband is selected as the strategy for HyperParameterTuningJobConfig.

nested_items.name: HyperbandStrategyConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the object that specifies the Hyperband strategy. This parameter is only supported for the Hyperband selection for Strategy within the HyperParameterTuningJobConfig API.

nested_items.name: MinResource
nested_items.description: The minimum number of resources (such as epochs) that can be used by a training job launched by a hyperparameter tuning job. If the value for MinResource has not been reached, the training job is not stopped by Hyperband.

nested_items.name: MaxResource
nested_items.description: The maximum number of resources (such as epochs) that can be used by a training job launched by a hyperparameter tuning job. Once a job reaches the MaxResource value, it is stopped. If a value for MaxResource is not provided, and Hyperband is selected as the hyperparameter tuning strategy, HyperbandTraining attempts to infer MaxResource from the following keys (if present) in StaticsHyperParameters:
epochs.
numepochs.
n-epochs.
n_epochs.
num_epochs.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterTuningJobObjective
nested_items.description: The HyperParameterTuningJobObjective specifies the objective metric used to evaluate the performance of training jobs launched by this tuning job.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Whether to minimize or maximize the objective metric.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric to use for the objective metric.

nested_items.name: ResourceLimits
nested_items.description: The ResourceLimits object that specifies the maximum number of training and parallel training jobs that can be used for this hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: MaxNumberOfTrainingJobs
nested_items.description: The maximum number of training jobs that a hyperparameter tuning job can launch.

nested_items.name: MaxParallelTrainingJobs
nested_items.description: The maximum number of concurrent training jobs that a hyperparameter tuning job can launch.

nested_items.name: MaxRuntimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum time in seconds that a hyperparameter tuning job can run.

nested_items.name: ParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The ParameterRanges object that specifies the ranges of hyperparameters that this tuning job searches over to find the optimal configuration for the highest model performance against your chosen objective metric.

nested_items.name: IntegerParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The array of IntegerParameterRange objects that specify ranges of integer hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the hyperparameter to search.

nested_items.name: MinValue
nested_items.description: The minimum value of the hyperparameter to search.

nested_items.name: MaxValue
nested_items.description: The maximum value of the hyperparameter to search.

nested_items.name: ScalingType
nested_items.description: The scale that hyperparameter tuning uses to search the hyperparameter range. For information about choosing a hyperparameter scale, see Hyperparameter Scaling. One of the following values:

nested_items.name: ContinuousParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The array of ContinuousParameterRange objects that specify ranges of continuous hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the continuous hyperparameter to tune.

nested_items.name: MinValue
nested_items.description: The minimum value for the hyperparameter. The tuning job uses floating-point values between this value and ``MaxValue``for tuning.

nested_items.name: MaxValue
nested_items.description: The maximum value for the hyperparameter. The tuning job uses floating-point values between MinValue value and this value for tuning.

nested_items.name: ScalingType
nested_items.description: The scale that hyperparameter tuning uses to search the hyperparameter range. For information about choosing a hyperparameter scale, see Hyperparameter Scaling. One of the following values:

nested_items.name: CategoricalParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The array of CategoricalParameterRange objects that specify ranges of categorical hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the categorical hyperparameter to tune.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: A list of the categories for the hyperparameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AutoParameters
nested_items.description: A list containing hyperparameter names and example values to be used by Autotune to determine optimal ranges for your tuning job.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the hyperparameter to optimize using Autotune.

nested_items.name: ValueHint
nested_items.description: An example value of the hyperparameter to optimize using Autotune.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobEarlyStoppingType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to use early stopping for training jobs launched by the hyperparameter tuning job. Because the Hyperband strategy has its own advanced internal early stopping mechanism, TrainingJobEarlyStoppingType must be OFF to use Hyperband. This parameter can take on one of the following values (the default value is OFF):

nested_items.name: TuningJobCompletionCriteria
nested_items.description: The tuning job's completion criteria.

nested_items.name: TargetObjectiveMetricValue
nested_items.description: The value of the objective metric.

nested_items.name: BestObjectiveNotImproving
nested_items.description: A flag to stop your hyperparameter tuning job if model performance fails to improve as evaluated against an objective function.

nested_items.name: MaxNumberOfTrainingJobsNotImproving
nested_items.description: The number of training jobs that have failed to improve model performance by 1% or greater over prior training jobs as evaluated against an objective function.

nested_items.name: ConvergenceDetected
nested_items.description: A flag to top your hyperparameter tuning job if automatic model tuning (AMT) has detected that your model has converged as evaluated against your objective function.

nested_items.name: CompleteOnConvergence
nested_items.description: A flag to stop a tuning job once AMT has detected that the job has converged.

nested_items.name: RandomSeed
nested_items.description: A value used to initialize a pseudo-random number generator. Setting a random seed and using the same seed later for the same tuning job will allow hyperparameter optimization to find more a consistent hyperparameter configuration between the two runs.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobDefinition
nested_items.description: The HyperParameterTrainingJobDefinition object that specifies the definition of the training jobs that this tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: DefinitionName
nested_items.description: The job definition name.

nested_items.name: TuningObjective
nested_items.description: Defines the objective metric for a hyperparameter tuning job. Hyperparameter tuning uses the value of this metric to evaluate the training jobs it launches, and returns the training job that results in either the highest or lowest value for this metric, depending on the value you specify for the Type parameter. If you want to define a custom objective metric, see Define metrics and environment variables.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Whether to minimize or maximize the objective metric.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric to use for the objective metric.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterRanges
nested_items.description: Specifies ranges of integer, continuous, and categorical hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches. The hyperparameter tuning job launches training jobs with hyperparameter values within these ranges to find the combination of values that result in the training job with the best performance as measured by the objective metric of the hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: IntegerParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The array of IntegerParameterRange objects that specify ranges of integer hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the hyperparameter to search.

nested_items.name: MinValue
nested_items.description: The minimum value of the hyperparameter to search.

nested_items.name: MaxValue
nested_items.description: The maximum value of the hyperparameter to search.

nested_items.name: ScalingType
nested_items.description: The scale that hyperparameter tuning uses to search the hyperparameter range. For information about choosing a hyperparameter scale, see Hyperparameter Scaling. One of the following values:

nested_items.name: ContinuousParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The array of ContinuousParameterRange objects that specify ranges of continuous hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the continuous hyperparameter to tune.

nested_items.name: MinValue
nested_items.description: The minimum value for the hyperparameter. The tuning job uses floating-point values between this value and ``MaxValue``for tuning.

nested_items.name: MaxValue
nested_items.description: The maximum value for the hyperparameter. The tuning job uses floating-point values between MinValue value and this value for tuning.

nested_items.name: ScalingType
nested_items.description: The scale that hyperparameter tuning uses to search the hyperparameter range. For information about choosing a hyperparameter scale, see Hyperparameter Scaling. One of the following values:

nested_items.name: CategoricalParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The array of CategoricalParameterRange objects that specify ranges of categorical hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the categorical hyperparameter to tune.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: A list of the categories for the hyperparameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AutoParameters
nested_items.description: A list containing hyperparameter names and example values to be used by Autotune to determine optimal ranges for your tuning job.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the hyperparameter to optimize using Autotune.

nested_items.name: ValueHint
nested_items.description: An example value of the hyperparameter to optimize using Autotune.

nested_items.name: StaticHyperParameters
nested_items.description: Specifies the values of hyperparameters that do not change for the tuning job.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AlgorithmSpecification
nested_items.description: The HyperParameterAlgorithmSpecification object that specifies the resource algorithm to use for the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: TrainingImage
nested_items.description: The registry path of the Docker image that contains the training algorithm. For information about Docker registry paths for built-in algorithms, see Algorithms Provided by Amazon SageMaker: Common Parameters. SageMaker supports both registry/repository[:tag] and registry/repository[@digest] image path formats. For more information, see Using Your Own Algorithms with Amazon SageMaker.

nested_items.name: TrainingInputMode
nested_items.description: The training input mode that the algorithm supports. For more information about input modes, see Algorithms.

nested_items.name: AlgorithmName
nested_items.description: The name of the resource algorithm to use for the hyperparameter tuning job. If you specify a value for this parameter, do not specify a value for TrainingImage.

nested_items.name: MetricDefinitions
nested_items.description: An array of MetricDefinition objects that specify the metrics that the algorithm emits.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the metric.

nested_items.name: Regex
nested_items.description: A regular expression that searches the output of a training job and gets the value of the metric. For more information about using regular expressions to define metrics, see Defining metrics and environment variables.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role associated with the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: InputDataConfig
nested_items.description: An array of Channel objects that specify the input for the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: ChannelName
nested_items.description: The name of the channel.

nested_items.name: DataSource
nested_items.description: The location of the channel data.

nested_items.name: S3DataSource
nested_items.description: The S3 location of the data source that is associated with a channel.

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: If you choose S3Prefix, S3Uri identifies a key name prefix. SageMaker uses all objects that match the specified key name prefix for model training.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest. For example:
A key name prefix might look like this: s3://bucketname/exampleprefix/

A manifest might look like this: s3://bucketname/example.manifest A manifest is an S3 object which is a JSON file consisting of an array of elements. The first element is a prefix which is followed by one or more suffixes. SageMaker appends the suffix elements to the prefix to get a full set of S3Uri. Note that the prefix must be a valid non-empty S3Uri that precludes users from specifying a manifest whose individual S3Uri is sourced from different S3 buckets. The following code example shows a valid manifest format: [ {"prefix": "s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/"}, "relative/path/to/custdata-1", "relative/path/custdata-2", ... "relative/path/custdata-N" ] This JSON is equivalent to the following S3Uri list: s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/to/custdata-1 s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-2 ... s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-N The complete set of S3Uri in this manifest is the input data for the channel for this data source. The object that each S3Uri points to must be readable by the IAM role that SageMaker uses to perform tasks on your behalf.

nested_items.name: S3DataDistributionType
nested_items.description: If you want SageMaker to replicate the entire dataset on each ML compute instance that is launched for model training, specify FullyReplicated.

nested_items.name: AttributeNames
nested_items.description: A list of one or more attribute names to use that are found in a specified augmented manifest file.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupNames
nested_items.description: A list of names of instance groups that get data from the S3 data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ModelAccessConfig
nested_items.description: The access configuration file to control access to the ML model. You can explicitly accept the model end-user license agreement (EULA) within the ModelAccessConfig.
If you are a Jumpstart user, see the End-user license agreements section for more details on accepting the EULA.

If you are an AutoML user, see the Optional Parameters section of Create an AutoML job to fine-tune text generation models using the API for details on How to set the EULA acceptance when fine-tuning a model using the AutoML API.

nested_items.name: HubAccessConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for a private hub model reference that points to a SageMaker JumpStart public hub model.

nested_items.name: HubContentArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of your private model hub content. This should be a ModelReference resource type that points to a SageMaker JumpStart public hub model.

nested_items.name: FileSystemDataSource
nested_items.description: The file system that is associated with a channel.

nested_items.name: FileSystemId
nested_items.description: The file system id.

nested_items.name: FileSystemAccessMode
nested_items.description: The access mode of the mount of the directory associated with the channel. A directory can be mounted either in ro (read-only) or rw (read-write) mode.

nested_items.name: FileSystemType
nested_items.description: The file system type.

nested_items.name: DirectoryPath
nested_items.description: The full path to the directory to associate with the channel.

nested_items.name: ContentType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the data.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: If training data is compressed, the compression type. The default value is None. CompressionType is used only in Pipe input mode. In File mode, leave this field unset or set it to None.

nested_items.name: RecordWrapperType
nested_items.description: Specify RecordIO as the value when input data is in raw format but the training algorithm requires the RecordIO format. In this case, SageMaker wraps each individual S3 object in a RecordIO record. If the input data is already in RecordIO format, you don't need to set this attribute. For more information, see Create a Dataset Using RecordIO.

nested_items.name: InputMode
nested_items.description: (Optional) The input mode to use for the data channel in a training job. If you don't set a value for InputMode, SageMaker uses the value set for TrainingInputMode. Use this parameter to override the TrainingInputMode setting in a AlgorithmSpecification request when you have a channel that needs a different input mode from the training job's general setting. To download the data from Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) to the provisioned ML storage volume, and mount the directory to a Docker volume, use File input mode. To stream data directly from Amazon S3 to the container, choose Pipe input mode.

nested_items.name: ShuffleConfig
nested_items.description: A configuration for a shuffle option for input data in a channel. If you use S3Prefix for S3DataType, this shuffles the results of the S3 key prefix matches. If you use ManifestFile, the order of the S3 object references in the ManifestFile is shuffled. If you use AugmentedManifestFile, the order of the JSON lines in the AugmentedManifestFile is shuffled. The shuffling order is determined using the Seed value.

nested_items.name: Seed
nested_items.description: Determines the shuffling order in ShuffleConfig value.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: The VpcConfig object that specifies the VPC that you want the training jobs that this hyperparameter tuning job launches to connect to. Control access to and from your training container by configuring the VPC. For more information, see Protect Training Jobs by Using an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The VPC security group IDs, in the form sg-xxxxxxxx. Specify the security groups for the VPC that is specified in the Subnets field.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnets in the VPC to which you want to connect your training job or model. For information about the availability of specific instance types, see Supported Instance Types and Availability Zones.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: OutputDataConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies the path to the Amazon S3 bucket where you store model artifacts from the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that SageMaker uses to encrypt the model artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. The KmsKeyId can be any of the following formats:
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// KMS Key Alias "alias/ExampleAlias"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key Alias "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want SageMaker to store the model artifacts. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: The model output compression type. Select None to output an uncompressed model, recommended for large model outputs. Defaults to gzip.

nested_items.name: ResourceConfig
nested_items.description: The resources, including the compute instances and storage volumes, to use for the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The ML compute instance type.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of ML compute instances to use. For distributed training, provide a value greater than 1.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size of the ML storage volume that you want to provision.

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key that SageMaker uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that run the training job.
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

nested_items.name: KeepAlivePeriodInSeconds
nested_items.description: The duration of time in seconds to retain configured resources in a warm pool for subsequent training jobs.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroups
nested_items.description: The configuration of a heterogeneous cluster in JSON format.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: Specifies the instance type of the instance group.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of instances of the instance group.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the instance group.

nested_items.name: TrainingPlanArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN); of the training plan to use for this resource configuration.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterTuningResourceConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the hyperparameter tuning resources, including the compute instances and storage volumes, used for training jobs launched by the tuning job. By default, storage volumes hold model artifacts and incremental states. Choose File for TrainingInputMode in the AlgorithmSpecification parameter to additionally store training data in the storage volume (optional).

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type used to run hyperparameter optimization tuning jobs. See descriptions of instance types for more information.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of compute instances of type InstanceType to use. For distributed training, select a value greater than 1.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The volume size in GB for the storage volume to be used in processing hyperparameter optimization jobs (optional). These volumes store model artifacts, incremental states and optionally, scratch space for training algorithms. Do not provide a value for this parameter if a value for InstanceConfigs is also specified.

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: A key used by Amazon Web Services Key Management Service to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the compute instances used to run the training job. You can use either of the following formats to specify a key.

nested_items.name: AllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: The strategy that determines the order of preference for resources specified in InstanceConfigs used in hyperparameter optimization.

nested_items.name: InstanceConfigs
nested_items.description: A list containing the configuration(s) for one or more resources for processing hyperparameter jobs. These resources include compute instances and storage volumes to use in model training jobs launched by hyperparameter tuning jobs. The AllocationStrategy controls the order in which multiple configurations provided in InstanceConfigs are used.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type used for processing of hyperparameter optimization jobs. Choose from general purpose (no GPUs) instance types: ml.m5.xlarge, ml.m5.2xlarge, and ml.m5.4xlarge or compute optimized (no GPUs) instance types: ml.c5.xlarge and ml.c5.2xlarge. For more information about instance types, see instance type descriptions.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of instances of the type specified by InstanceType. Choose an instance count larger than 1 for distributed training algorithms. See Step 2: Launch a SageMaker Distributed Training Job Using the SageMaker Python SDK for more information.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The volume size in GB of the data to be processed for hyperparameter optimization (optional).

nested_items.name: StoppingCondition
nested_items.description: Specifies a limit to how long a model hyperparameter training job can run. It also specifies how long a managed spot training job has to complete. When the job reaches the time limit, SageMaker ends the training job. Use this API to cap model training costs.

nested_items.name: MaxRuntimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a training or compilation job can run before it is stopped.

nested_items.name: MaxWaitTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a managed Spot training job has to complete. It is the amount of time spent waiting for Spot capacity plus the amount of time the job can run. It must be equal to or greater than MaxRuntimeInSeconds. If the job does not complete during this time, SageMaker ends the job.

nested_items.name: MaxPendingTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a training or compilation job can be pending before it is stopped.

nested_items.name: EnableNetworkIsolation
nested_items.description: Isolates the training container. No inbound or outbound network calls can be made, except for calls between peers within a training cluster for distributed training. If network isolation is used for training jobs that are configured to use a VPC, SageMaker downloads and uploads customer data and model artifacts through the specified VPC, but the training container does not have network access.

nested_items.name: EnableInterContainerTrafficEncryption
nested_items.description: To encrypt all communications between ML compute instances in distributed training, choose True. Encryption provides greater security for distributed training, but training might take longer. How long it takes depends on the amount of communication between compute instances, especially if you use a deep learning algorithm in distributed training.

nested_items.name: EnableManagedSpotTraining
nested_items.description: A Boolean indicating whether managed spot training is enabled ( True) or not ( False).

nested_items.name: CheckpointConfig
nested_items.description: Contains information about the output location for managed spot training checkpoint data.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want SageMaker to store checkpoints. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: (Optional) The local directory where checkpoints are written. The default directory is /opt/ml/checkpoints/.

nested_items.name: RetryStrategy
nested_items.description: The number of times to retry the job when the job fails due to an InternalServerError.

nested_items.name: MaximumRetryAttempts
nested_items.description: The number of times to retry the job. When the job is retried, it's SecondaryStatus is changed to STARTING.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: An environment variable that you can pass into the SageMaker CreateTrainingJob API. You can use an existing environment variable from the training container or use your own. See Define metrics and variables for more information.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TrainingJobDefinitions
nested_items.description: A list of the HyperParameterTrainingJobDefinition objects launched for this tuning job.

nested_items.name: DefinitionName
nested_items.description: The job definition name.

nested_items.name: TuningObjective
nested_items.description: Defines the objective metric for a hyperparameter tuning job. Hyperparameter tuning uses the value of this metric to evaluate the training jobs it launches, and returns the training job that results in either the highest or lowest value for this metric, depending on the value you specify for the Type parameter. If you want to define a custom objective metric, see Define metrics and environment variables.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Whether to minimize or maximize the objective metric.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric to use for the objective metric.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterRanges
nested_items.description: Specifies ranges of integer, continuous, and categorical hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches. The hyperparameter tuning job launches training jobs with hyperparameter values within these ranges to find the combination of values that result in the training job with the best performance as measured by the objective metric of the hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: IntegerParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The array of IntegerParameterRange objects that specify ranges of integer hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the hyperparameter to search.

nested_items.name: MinValue
nested_items.description: The minimum value of the hyperparameter to search.

nested_items.name: MaxValue
nested_items.description: The maximum value of the hyperparameter to search.

nested_items.name: ScalingType
nested_items.description: The scale that hyperparameter tuning uses to search the hyperparameter range. For information about choosing a hyperparameter scale, see Hyperparameter Scaling. One of the following values:

nested_items.name: ContinuousParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The array of ContinuousParameterRange objects that specify ranges of continuous hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the continuous hyperparameter to tune.

nested_items.name: MinValue
nested_items.description: The minimum value for the hyperparameter. The tuning job uses floating-point values between this value and ``MaxValue``for tuning.

nested_items.name: MaxValue
nested_items.description: The maximum value for the hyperparameter. The tuning job uses floating-point values between MinValue value and this value for tuning.

nested_items.name: ScalingType
nested_items.description: The scale that hyperparameter tuning uses to search the hyperparameter range. For information about choosing a hyperparameter scale, see Hyperparameter Scaling. One of the following values:

nested_items.name: CategoricalParameterRanges
nested_items.description: The array of CategoricalParameterRange objects that specify ranges of categorical hyperparameters that a hyperparameter tuning job searches.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the categorical hyperparameter to tune.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: A list of the categories for the hyperparameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AutoParameters
nested_items.description: A list containing hyperparameter names and example values to be used by Autotune to determine optimal ranges for your tuning job.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the hyperparameter to optimize using Autotune.

nested_items.name: ValueHint
nested_items.description: An example value of the hyperparameter to optimize using Autotune.

nested_items.name: StaticHyperParameters
nested_items.description: Specifies the values of hyperparameters that do not change for the tuning job.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AlgorithmSpecification
nested_items.description: The HyperParameterAlgorithmSpecification object that specifies the resource algorithm to use for the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: TrainingImage
nested_items.description: The registry path of the Docker image that contains the training algorithm. For information about Docker registry paths for built-in algorithms, see Algorithms Provided by Amazon SageMaker: Common Parameters. SageMaker supports both registry/repository[:tag] and registry/repository[@digest] image path formats. For more information, see Using Your Own Algorithms with Amazon SageMaker.

nested_items.name: TrainingInputMode
nested_items.description: The training input mode that the algorithm supports. For more information about input modes, see Algorithms.

nested_items.name: AlgorithmName
nested_items.description: The name of the resource algorithm to use for the hyperparameter tuning job. If you specify a value for this parameter, do not specify a value for TrainingImage.

nested_items.name: MetricDefinitions
nested_items.description: An array of MetricDefinition objects that specify the metrics that the algorithm emits.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the metric.

nested_items.name: Regex
nested_items.description: A regular expression that searches the output of a training job and gets the value of the metric. For more information about using regular expressions to define metrics, see Defining metrics and environment variables.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role associated with the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: InputDataConfig
nested_items.description: An array of Channel objects that specify the input for the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: ChannelName
nested_items.description: The name of the channel.

nested_items.name: DataSource
nested_items.description: The location of the channel data.

nested_items.name: S3DataSource
nested_items.description: The S3 location of the data source that is associated with a channel.

nested_items.name: S3DataType
nested_items.description: If you choose S3Prefix, S3Uri identifies a key name prefix. SageMaker uses all objects that match the specified key name prefix for model training.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest. For example:
A key name prefix might look like this: s3://bucketname/exampleprefix/

A manifest might look like this: s3://bucketname/example.manifest A manifest is an S3 object which is a JSON file consisting of an array of elements. The first element is a prefix which is followed by one or more suffixes. SageMaker appends the suffix elements to the prefix to get a full set of S3Uri. Note that the prefix must be a valid non-empty S3Uri that precludes users from specifying a manifest whose individual S3Uri is sourced from different S3 buckets. The following code example shows a valid manifest format: [ {"prefix": "s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/"}, "relative/path/to/custdata-1", "relative/path/custdata-2", ... "relative/path/custdata-N" ] This JSON is equivalent to the following S3Uri list: s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/to/custdata-1 s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-2 ... s3://customer_bucket/some/prefix/relative/path/custdata-N The complete set of S3Uri in this manifest is the input data for the channel for this data source. The object that each S3Uri points to must be readable by the IAM role that SageMaker uses to perform tasks on your behalf.

nested_items.name: S3DataDistributionType
nested_items.description: If you want SageMaker to replicate the entire dataset on each ML compute instance that is launched for model training, specify FullyReplicated.

nested_items.name: AttributeNames
nested_items.description: A list of one or more attribute names to use that are found in a specified augmented manifest file.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupNames
nested_items.description: A list of names of instance groups that get data from the S3 data source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ModelAccessConfig
nested_items.description: The access configuration file to control access to the ML model. You can explicitly accept the model end-user license agreement (EULA) within the ModelAccessConfig.
If you are a Jumpstart user, see the End-user license agreements section for more details on accepting the EULA.

If you are an AutoML user, see the Optional Parameters section of Create an AutoML job to fine-tune text generation models using the API for details on How to set the EULA acceptance when fine-tuning a model using the AutoML API.

nested_items.name: HubAccessConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for a private hub model reference that points to a SageMaker JumpStart public hub model.

nested_items.name: HubContentArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of your private model hub content. This should be a ModelReference resource type that points to a SageMaker JumpStart public hub model.

nested_items.name: FileSystemDataSource
nested_items.description: The file system that is associated with a channel.

nested_items.name: FileSystemId
nested_items.description: The file system id.

nested_items.name: FileSystemAccessMode
nested_items.description: The access mode of the mount of the directory associated with the channel. A directory can be mounted either in ro (read-only) or rw (read-write) mode.

nested_items.name: FileSystemType
nested_items.description: The file system type.

nested_items.name: DirectoryPath
nested_items.description: The full path to the directory to associate with the channel.

nested_items.name: ContentType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the data.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: If training data is compressed, the compression type. The default value is None. CompressionType is used only in Pipe input mode. In File mode, leave this field unset or set it to None.

nested_items.name: RecordWrapperType
nested_items.description: Specify RecordIO as the value when input data is in raw format but the training algorithm requires the RecordIO format. In this case, SageMaker wraps each individual S3 object in a RecordIO record. If the input data is already in RecordIO format, you don't need to set this attribute. For more information, see Create a Dataset Using RecordIO.

nested_items.name: InputMode
nested_items.description: (Optional) The input mode to use for the data channel in a training job. If you don't set a value for InputMode, SageMaker uses the value set for TrainingInputMode. Use this parameter to override the TrainingInputMode setting in a AlgorithmSpecification request when you have a channel that needs a different input mode from the training job's general setting. To download the data from Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) to the provisioned ML storage volume, and mount the directory to a Docker volume, use File input mode. To stream data directly from Amazon S3 to the container, choose Pipe input mode.

nested_items.name: ShuffleConfig
nested_items.description: A configuration for a shuffle option for input data in a channel. If you use S3Prefix for S3DataType, this shuffles the results of the S3 key prefix matches. If you use ManifestFile, the order of the S3 object references in the ManifestFile is shuffled. If you use AugmentedManifestFile, the order of the JSON lines in the AugmentedManifestFile is shuffled. The shuffling order is determined using the Seed value.

nested_items.name: Seed
nested_items.description: Determines the shuffling order in ShuffleConfig value.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: The VpcConfig object that specifies the VPC that you want the training jobs that this hyperparameter tuning job launches to connect to. Control access to and from your training container by configuring the VPC. For more information, see Protect Training Jobs by Using an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The VPC security group IDs, in the form sg-xxxxxxxx. Specify the security groups for the VPC that is specified in the Subnets field.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnets in the VPC to which you want to connect your training job or model. For information about the availability of specific instance types, see Supported Instance Types and Availability Zones.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: OutputDataConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies the path to the Amazon S3 bucket where you store model artifacts from the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that SageMaker uses to encrypt the model artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. The KmsKeyId can be any of the following formats:
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// KMS Key Alias "alias/ExampleAlias"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key Alias "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want SageMaker to store the model artifacts. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_items.name: CompressionType
nested_items.description: The model output compression type. Select None to output an uncompressed model, recommended for large model outputs. Defaults to gzip.

nested_items.name: ResourceConfig
nested_items.description: The resources, including the compute instances and storage volumes, to use for the training jobs that the tuning job launches.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The ML compute instance type.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of ML compute instances to use. For distributed training, provide a value greater than 1.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size of the ML storage volume that you want to provision.

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key that SageMaker uses to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that run the training job.
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"

nested_items.name: KeepAlivePeriodInSeconds
nested_items.description: The duration of time in seconds to retain configured resources in a warm pool for subsequent training jobs.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroups
nested_items.description: The configuration of a heterogeneous cluster in JSON format.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: Specifies the instance type of the instance group.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of instances of the instance group.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the instance group.

nested_items.name: TrainingPlanArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN); of the training plan to use for this resource configuration.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterTuningResourceConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the hyperparameter tuning resources, including the compute instances and storage volumes, used for training jobs launched by the tuning job. By default, storage volumes hold model artifacts and incremental states. Choose File for TrainingInputMode in the AlgorithmSpecification parameter to additionally store training data in the storage volume (optional).

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type used to run hyperparameter optimization tuning jobs. See descriptions of instance types for more information.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of compute instances of type InstanceType to use. For distributed training, select a value greater than 1.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The volume size in GB for the storage volume to be used in processing hyperparameter optimization jobs (optional). These volumes store model artifacts, incremental states and optionally, scratch space for training algorithms. Do not provide a value for this parameter if a value for InstanceConfigs is also specified.

nested_items.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: A key used by Amazon Web Services Key Management Service to encrypt data on the storage volume attached to the compute instances used to run the training job. You can use either of the following formats to specify a key.

nested_items.name: AllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: The strategy that determines the order of preference for resources specified in InstanceConfigs used in hyperparameter optimization.

nested_items.name: InstanceConfigs
nested_items.description: A list containing the configuration(s) for one or more resources for processing hyperparameter jobs. These resources include compute instances and storage volumes to use in model training jobs launched by hyperparameter tuning jobs. The AllocationStrategy controls the order in which multiple configurations provided in InstanceConfigs are used.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type used for processing of hyperparameter optimization jobs. Choose from general purpose (no GPUs) instance types: ml.m5.xlarge, ml.m5.2xlarge, and ml.m5.4xlarge or compute optimized (no GPUs) instance types: ml.c5.xlarge and ml.c5.2xlarge. For more information about instance types, see instance type descriptions.

nested_items.name: InstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of instances of the type specified by InstanceType. Choose an instance count larger than 1 for distributed training algorithms. See Step 2: Launch a SageMaker Distributed Training Job Using the SageMaker Python SDK for more information.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The volume size in GB of the data to be processed for hyperparameter optimization (optional).

nested_items.name: StoppingCondition
nested_items.description: Specifies a limit to how long a model hyperparameter training job can run. It also specifies how long a managed spot training job has to complete. When the job reaches the time limit, SageMaker ends the training job. Use this API to cap model training costs.

nested_items.name: MaxRuntimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a training or compilation job can run before it is stopped.

nested_items.name: MaxWaitTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a managed Spot training job has to complete. It is the amount of time spent waiting for Spot capacity plus the amount of time the job can run. It must be equal to or greater than MaxRuntimeInSeconds. If the job does not complete during this time, SageMaker ends the job.

nested_items.name: MaxPendingTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum length of time, in seconds, that a training or compilation job can be pending before it is stopped.

nested_items.name: EnableNetworkIsolation
nested_items.description: Isolates the training container. No inbound or outbound network calls can be made, except for calls between peers within a training cluster for distributed training. If network isolation is used for training jobs that are configured to use a VPC, SageMaker downloads and uploads customer data and model artifacts through the specified VPC, but the training container does not have network access.

nested_items.name: EnableInterContainerTrafficEncryption
nested_items.description: To encrypt all communications between ML compute instances in distributed training, choose True. Encryption provides greater security for distributed training, but training might take longer. How long it takes depends on the amount of communication between compute instances, especially if you use a deep learning algorithm in distributed training.

nested_items.name: EnableManagedSpotTraining
nested_items.description: A Boolean indicating whether managed spot training is enabled ( True) or not ( False).

nested_items.name: CheckpointConfig
nested_items.description: Contains information about the output location for managed spot training checkpoint data.

nested_items.name: S3Uri
nested_items.description: Identifies the S3 path where you want SageMaker to store checkpoints. For example, s3://bucket-name/key-name-prefix.

nested_items.name: LocalPath
nested_items.description: (Optional) The local directory where checkpoints are written. The default directory is /opt/ml/checkpoints/.

nested_items.name: RetryStrategy
nested_items.description: The number of times to retry the job when the job fails due to an InternalServerError.

nested_items.name: MaximumRetryAttempts
nested_items.description: The number of times to retry the job. When the job is retried, it's SecondaryStatus is changed to STARTING.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: An environment variable that you can pass into the SageMaker CreateTrainingJob API. You can use an existing environment variable from the training container or use your own. See Define metrics and variables for more information.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: HyperParameterTuningJobStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the tuning job.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the tuning job started.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterTuningEndTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the tuning job ended.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the status of the tuning job was modified.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobStatusCounters
nested_items.description: The TrainingJobStatusCounters object that specifies the number of training jobs, categorized by status, that this tuning job launched.

nested_items.name: Completed
nested_items.description: The number of completed training jobs launched by the hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: InProgress
nested_items.description: The number of in-progress training jobs launched by a hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: RetryableError
nested_items.description: The number of training jobs that failed, but can be retried. A failed training job can be retried only if it failed because an internal service error occurred.

nested_items.name: NonRetryableError
nested_items.description: The number of training jobs that failed and can't be retried. A failed training job can't be retried if it failed because a client error occurred.

nested_items.name: Stopped
nested_items.description: The number of training jobs launched by a hyperparameter tuning job that were manually stopped.

nested_items.name: ObjectiveStatusCounters
nested_items.description: The ObjectiveStatusCounters object that specifies the number of training jobs, categorized by the status of their final objective metric, that this tuning job launched.

nested_items.name: Succeeded
nested_items.description: The number of training jobs whose final objective metric was evaluated by the hyperparameter tuning job and used in the hyperparameter tuning process.

nested_items.name: Pending
nested_items.description: The number of training jobs that are in progress and pending evaluation of their final objective metric.

nested_items.name: Failed
nested_items.description: The number of training jobs whose final objective metric was not evaluated and used in the hyperparameter tuning process. This typically occurs when the training job failed or did not emit an objective metric.

nested_items.name: BestTrainingJob
nested_items.description: A TrainingJobSummary object that describes the training job that completed with the best current HyperParameterTuningJobObjective.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobDefinitionName
nested_items.description: The training job definition name.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobName
nested_items.description: The name of the training job.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the training job.

nested_items.name: TuningJobName
nested_items.description: The HyperParameter tuning job that launched the training job.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the training job was created.

nested_items.name: TrainingStartTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the training job started.

nested_items.name: TrainingEndTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the time when the training job ends on training instances. You are billed for the time interval between the value of TrainingStartTime and this time. For successful jobs and stopped jobs, this is the time after model artifacts are uploaded. For failed jobs, this is the time when SageMaker detects a job failure.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the training job.

nested_items.name: TunedHyperParameters
nested_items.description: A list of the hyperparameters for which you specified ranges to search.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: The reason that the training job failed.

nested_items.name: FinalHyperParameterTuningJobObjectiveMetric
nested_items.description: The FinalHyperParameterTuningJobObjectiveMetric object that specifies the value of the objective metric of the tuning job that launched this training job.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Select if you want to minimize or maximize the objective metric during hyperparameter tuning.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the objective metric. For SageMaker built-in algorithms, metrics are defined per algorithm. See the metrics for XGBoost as an example. You can also use a custom algorithm for training and define your own metrics. For more information, see Define metrics and environment variables.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the objective metric.

nested_items.name: ObjectiveStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the objective metric for the training job:
Succeeded: The final objective metric for the training job was evaluated by the hyperparameter tuning job and used in the hyperparameter tuning process.
Pending: The training job is in progress and evaluation of its final objective metric is pending.

Failed: The final objective metric for the training job was not evaluated, and was not used in the hyperparameter tuning process. This typically occurs when the training job failed or did not emit an objective metric.

nested_items.name: OverallBestTrainingJob
nested_items.description: If the hyperparameter tuning job is an warm start tuning job with a WarmStartType of IDENTICAL_DATA_AND_ALGORITHM, this is the TrainingJobSummary for the training job with the best objective metric value of all training jobs launched by this tuning job and all parent jobs specified for the warm start tuning job.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobDefinitionName
nested_items.description: The training job definition name.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobName
nested_items.description: The name of the training job.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the training job.

nested_items.name: TuningJobName
nested_items.description: The HyperParameter tuning job that launched the training job.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the training job was created.

nested_items.name: TrainingStartTime
nested_items.description: The date and time that the training job started.

nested_items.name: TrainingEndTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the time when the training job ends on training instances. You are billed for the time interval between the value of TrainingStartTime and this time. For successful jobs and stopped jobs, this is the time after model artifacts are uploaded. For failed jobs, this is the time when SageMaker detects a job failure.

nested_items.name: TrainingJobStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the training job.

nested_items.name: TunedHyperParameters
nested_items.description: A list of the hyperparameters for which you specified ranges to search.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: The reason that the training job failed.

nested_items.name: FinalHyperParameterTuningJobObjectiveMetric
nested_items.description: The FinalHyperParameterTuningJobObjectiveMetric object that specifies the value of the objective metric of the tuning job that launched this training job.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Select if you want to minimize or maximize the objective metric during hyperparameter tuning.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the objective metric. For SageMaker built-in algorithms, metrics are defined per algorithm. See the metrics for XGBoost as an example. You can also use a custom algorithm for training and define your own metrics. For more information, see Define metrics and environment variables.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the objective metric.

nested_items.name: ObjectiveStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the objective metric for the training job:
Succeeded: The final objective metric for the training job was evaluated by the hyperparameter tuning job and used in the hyperparameter tuning process.
Pending: The training job is in progress and evaluation of its final objective metric is pending.

Failed: The final objective metric for the training job was not evaluated, and was not used in the hyperparameter tuning process. This typically occurs when the training job failed or did not emit an objective metric.

nested_items.name: WarmStartConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for starting the hyperparameter parameter tuning job using one or more previous tuning jobs as a starting point. The results of previous tuning jobs are used to inform which combinations of hyperparameters to search over in the new tuning job.

nested_items.name: ParentHyperParameterTuningJobs
nested_items.description: An array of hyperparameter tuning jobs that are used as the starting point for the new hyperparameter tuning job. For more information about warm starting a hyperparameter tuning job, see Using a Previous Hyperparameter Tuning Job as a Starting Point.

nested_items.name: HyperParameterTuningJobName
nested_items.description: The name of the hyperparameter tuning job to be used as a starting point for a new hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: WarmStartType
nested_items.description: Specifies one of the following:

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: Set Mode to Enabled if you want to use Autotune.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: If the tuning job failed, the reason it failed.

nested_items.name: TuningJobCompletionDetails
nested_items.description: Tuning job completion information returned as the response from a hyperparameter tuning job. This information tells if your tuning job has or has not converged. It also includes the number of training jobs that have not improved model performance as evaluated against the objective function.

nested_items.name: NumberOfTrainingJobsObjectiveNotImproving
nested_items.description: The number of training jobs launched by a tuning job that are not improving (1% or less) as measured by model performance evaluated against an objective function.

nested_items.name: ConvergenceDetectedTime
nested_items.description: The time in timestamp format that AMT detected model convergence, as defined by a lack of significant improvement over time based on criteria developed over a wide range of diverse benchmarking tests.

nested_items.name: ConsumedResources
nested_items.description: The total resources consumed by your hyperparameter tuning job.

nested_items.name: RuntimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The wall clock runtime in seconds used by your hyperparameter tuning job.
